message.content:
Implement the following plan:

# Lint Cleanup Plan

## Context
All packages pass with 0 errors and clean typecheck. There are warnings across packages. Focusing on easily fixable ones — skipping `effect-cloudflare` (internal CF bindings, `any` from CF runtime) and most `pipeline` warnings (scraping code, type assertions on `JSON.parse`, negated conditions that are more readable as-is).

## Summary: 116 total warnings, 0 errors

| Package | Warnings | Fixable Now |
|---------|----------|-------------|
| effect-cloudflare | 35 | 0 (CF runtime types) |
| @laxdb/pipeline | 53 | 2 (unused imports) |
| @laxdb/marketing | 19 | 16 |
| @laxdb/core | 6 | 5 |
| @laxdb/web | 3 | 2 |
| @laxdb/ui | 2 | 1 |
| @laxdb/api | 0 | - |
| @laxdb/docs | 0 | - |
| @laxdb/scripts | 0 | - |

## Fixes

### 1. @laxdb/core — `getTableColumns` → `getColumns` (5 files)
Drizzle deprecated `getTableColumns`, replacement is `getColumns`.
- `src/game/game.repo.ts:20`
- `src/player/contact-info/contact-info.repo.ts:22`
- `src/feedback/feedback.repo.ts:16`
- `src/player/player.repo.ts:27`
- `src/season/season.repo.ts:20`

### 2. @laxdb/marketing — unescaped entities (14 instances)
Replace `'` with `'` and `"` with `"` in JSX text:
- `src/routes/brand.tsx:187,192` — apostrophes
- `src/routes/about.tsx:25,26,36,37,38,41,42` — apostrophes
- `src/routes/design-system.tsx:390,398` — quotes around import path

### 3. @laxdb/marketing — unused import
- `src/components/ui/features.tsx:4` — remove `RiCircleLine`

### 4. @laxdb/marketing — switch exhaustiveness
- `src/routes/blog/index.tsx:26` — add missing case to switch

### 5. @laxdb/pipeline — unused imports
- `src/extract/pll/pll.manifest.ts:1` — remove `Schema`
- `src/extract/pll/pll.extractor.ts:14` — remove `PLLTeamDetail`

### 6. @laxdb/web — empty file
- Delete `src/lib/runtime.atom.ts` (only contains comments)

### 7. @laxdb/ui — function scoping
- `src/hooks/use-sound.ts:36` — move `getMatches` outside `useMediaQuery`

## Not fixing (intentional or low-value)
- `effect-cloudflare` — all 35 warnings are CF runtime type mismatches
- `pipeline` — `no-negated-condition`, `max-depth`, `consistent-function-scoping`, type assertions on `JSON.parse` in scraping code
- `@laxdb/ui` `.storybook/preview.ts` — CSS side-effect import, intentional
- `@laxdb/marketing` `feedback.tsx:85` — `no-promise-executor-return` on `setTimeout` in a TODO stub
- `@laxdb/marketing` `kitchen-sink.tsx:242` — Base UI `SelectValue` render prop type
- `@laxdb/marketing` `blog/index.tsx:18` — validated search type narrowing
- `@laxdb/web` type assertions — runtime workarounds for API types
- `@laxdb/core` `util.ts:16` — `JSON.parse` cast, common pattern

## Verification
```bash
bun run lint && bun run typecheck
```


If you need specific details from before exiting plan mode (like exact code snippets, error messages, or content you generated), read the full transcript at: /Users/jw/.REDACTED.jsonl

If this plan can be broken down into multiple independent tasks, consider using the TeamCreate tool to create a team and parallelize the work.

planContent:
# Lint Cleanup Plan

## Context
All packages pass with 0 errors and clean typecheck. There are warnings across packages. Focusing on easily fixable ones — skipping `effect-cloudflare` (internal CF bindings, `any` from CF runtime) and most `pipeline` warnings (scraping code, type assertions on `JSON.parse`, negated conditions that are more readable as-is).

## Summary: 116 total warnings, 0 errors

| Package | Warnings | Fixable Now |
|---------|----------|-------------|
| effect-cloudflare | 35 | 0 (CF runtime types) |
| @laxdb/pipeline | 53 | 2 (unused imports) |
| @laxdb/marketing | 19 | 16 |
| @laxdb/core | 6 | 5 |
| @laxdb/web | 3 | 2 |
| @laxdb/ui | 2 | 1 |
| @laxdb/api | 0 | - |
| @laxdb/docs | 0 | - |
| @laxdb/scripts | 0 | - |

## Fixes

### 1. @laxdb/core — `getTableColumns` → `getColumns` (5 files)
Drizzle deprecated `getTableColumns`, replacement is `getColumns`.
- `src/game/game.repo.ts:20`
- `src/player/contact-info/contact-info.repo.ts:22`
- `src/feedback/feedback.repo.ts:16`
- `src/player/player.repo.ts:27`
- `src/season/season.repo.ts:20`

### 2. @laxdb/marketing — unescaped entities (14 instances)
Replace `'` with `'` and `"` with `"` in JSX text:
- `src/routes/brand.tsx:187,192` — apostrophes
- `src/routes/about.tsx:25,26,36,37,38,41,42` — apostrophes
- `src/routes/design-system.tsx:390,398` — quotes around import path

### 3. @laxdb/marketing — unused import
- `src/components/ui/features.tsx:4` — remove `RiCircleLine`

### 4. @laxdb/marketing — switch exhaustiveness
- `src/routes/blog/index.tsx:26` — add missing case to switch

### 5. @laxdb/pipeline — unused imports
- `src/extract/pll/pll.manifest.ts:1` — remove `Schema`
- `src/extract/pll/pll.extractor.ts:14` — remove `PLLTeamDetail`

### 6. @laxdb/web — empty file
- Delete `src/lib/runtime.atom.ts` (only contains comments)

### 7. @laxdb/ui — function scoping
- `src/hooks/use-sound.ts:36` — move `getMatches` outside `useMediaQuery`

## Not fixing (intentional or low-value)
- `effect-cloudflare` — all 35 warnings are CF runtime type mismatches
- `pipeline` — `no-negated-condition`, `max-depth`, `consistent-function-scoping`, type assertions on `JSON.parse` in scraping code
- `@laxdb/ui` `.storybook/preview.ts` — CSS side-effect import, intentional
- `@laxdb/marketing` `feedback.tsx:85` — `no-promise-executor-return` on `setTimeout` in a TODO stub
- `@laxdb/marketing` `kitchen-sink.tsx:242` — Base UI `SelectValue` render prop type
- `@laxdb/marketing` `blog/index.tsx:18` — validated search type narrowing
- `@laxdb/web` type assertions — runtime workarounds for API types
- `@laxdb/core` `util.ts:16` — `JSON.parse` cast, common pattern

## Verification
```bash
bun run lint && bun run typecheck
```

1→import { PgDrizzle } from "@effect/sql-drizzle/Pg";
     2→import { and, eq, getTableColumns, isNull } from "drizzle-orm";
     3→import { Array as Arr, Effect } from "effect";
     4→
     5→import { DatabaseLive } from "../drizzle/drizzle.service";
     6→
     7→import type {
     8→  CreateGameInput,
     9→  DeleteGameInput,
    10→  GetAllGamesInput,
    11→  GetGameInput,
    12→  UpdateGameInput,
    13→} from "./game.schema";
    14→import { type GameSelect, gameTable } from "./game.sql";
    15→
    16→export class GameRepo extends Effect.Service<GameRepo>()("GameRepo", {
    17→  effect: Effect.gen(function* () {
    18→    const db = yield* PgDrizzle;
    19→
    20→    const { id: _, ...rest } = getTableColumns(gameTable);
    21→
    22→    return {
    23→      list: (input: GetAllGamesInput) =>
    24→        Effect.gen(function* () {
    25→          const games: GameSelect[] = yield* db
    26→            .select(rest)
    27→            .from(gameTable)
    28→            .where(
    29→              and(
    30→                eq(gameTable.organizationId, input.organizationId),
    31→                input.teamId ? eq(gameTable.teamId, input.teamId) : undefined,
    32→                isNull(gameTable.deletedAt),
    33→              ),
    34→            )
    35→            .pipe(Effect.tapError(Effect.logError));
    36→
    37→          return games;
    38→        }),
    39→      get: (input: GetGameInput) =>
    40→        Effect.gen(function* () {
    41→          const game: GameSelect = yield* db
    42→            .select(rest)
    43→            .from(gameTable)
    44→            .where(
    45→              and(
    46→                eq(gameTable.publicId, input.publicId),
    47→                eq(gameTable.organizationId, input.organizationId),
    48→                input.teamId ? eq(gameTable.teamId, input.teamId) : undefined,
    49→                isNull(gameTable.deletedAt),
    50→              ),
    51→            )
    52→            .pipe(Effect.flatMap(Arr.head), Effect.tapError(Effect.logError));
    53→
    54→          return game;
    55→        }),
    56→      create: (input: CreateGameInput) =>
    57→        Effect.gen(function* () {
    58→          const game: GameSelect = yield* db
    59→            .insert(gameTable)
    60→            .values({
    61→              organizationId: input.organizationId,
    62→              teamId: input.teamId,
    63→              seasonId: input.seasonId,
    64→              opponentName: input.opponentName,
    65→              gameDate: input.gameDate,
    66→              venue: input.venue,
    67→              isHomeGame: input.isHomeGame,
    68→              gameType: input.gameType ?? "regular",
    69→              status: input.status ?? "scheduled",
    70→            })
    71→            .returning(rest)
    72→            .pipe(Effect.flatMap(Arr.head), Effect.tapError(Effect.logError));
    73→
    74→          return game;
    75→        }),
    76→      update: (input: UpdateGameInput) =>
    77→        db
    78→          .update(gameTable)
    79→          .set({
    80→            ...(input.opponentName !== undefined && {
    81→              opponentName: input.opponentName,
    82→            }),
    83→            ...(input.gameDate !== undefined && {
    84→              gameDate: input.gameDate,
    85→            }),
    86→            ...(input.venue !== undefined && { venue: input.venue }),
    87→            ...(input.isHomeGame !== undefined && {
    88→              isHomeGame: input.isHomeGame,
    89→            }),
    90→            ...(input.gameType !== undefined && {
    91→              gameType: input.gameType,
    92→            }),
    93→            ...(input.status !== undefined && { status: input.status }),
    94→            ...(input.homeScore !== undefined && {
    95→              homeScore: input.homeScore,
    96→            }),
    97→            ...(input.awayScore !== undefined && {
    98→              awayScore: input.awayScore,
    99→            }),
   100→            ...(input.notes !== undefined && { notes: input.notes }),
   101→            ...(input.location !== undefined && {
   102→              location: input.location,
   103→            }),
   104→            ...(input.uniformColor !== undefined && {
   105→              uniformColor: input.uniformColor,
   106→            }),
   107→            ...(input.arrivalTime !== undefined && {
   108→              arrivalTime: input.arrivalTime,
   109→            }),
   110→            ...(input.opponentLogoUrl !== undefined && {
   111→              opponentLogoUrl: input.opponentLogoUrl,
   112→            }),
   113→            ...(input.externalGameId !== undefined && {
   114→              externalGameId: input.externalGameId,
   115→            }),
   116→          })
   117→          .where(
   118→            and(
   119→              eq(gameTable.publicId, input.publicId),
   120→              eq(gameTable.organizationId, input.organizationId),
   121→              input.teamId ? eq(gameTable.teamId, input.teamId) : undefined,
   122→              isNull(gameTable.deletedAt),
   123→            ),
   124→          )
   125→          .returning(rest)
   126→          .pipe(Effect.flatMap(Arr.head), Effect.tapError(Effect.logError)),
   127→      delete: (input: DeleteGameInput) =>
   128→        db
   129→          .update(gameTable)
   130→          .set({ deletedAt: new Date() })
   131→          .where(
   132→            and(
   133→              eq(gameTable.publicId, input.publicId),
   134→              eq(gameTable.organizationId, input.organizationId),
   135→              input.teamId ? eq(gameTable.teamId, input.teamId) : undefined,
   136→              isNull(gameTable.deletedAt),
   137→            ),
   138→          )
   139→          .returning(rest)
   140→          .pipe(Effect.flatMap(Arr.head), Effect.tapError(Effect.logError)),
   141→    } as const;
   142→  }),
   143→  dependencies: [DatabaseLive],
   144→}) {}
   145→

1→import { PgDrizzle } from "@effect/sql-drizzle/Pg";
     2→import { and, eq, getTableColumns, inArray, isNull } from "drizzle-orm";
     3→import { Array as Arr, Effect } from "effect";
     4→
     5→import { DatabaseLive } from "../drizzle/drizzle.service";
     6→
     7→import type {
     8→  AddPlayerToTeamInput,
     9→  BulkDeletePlayersInput,
    10→  CreatePlayerInput,
    11→  DeletePlayerInput,
    12→  GetAllPlayersInput,
    13→  GetTeamPlayersInput,
    14→  UpdatePlayerInput,
    15→  UpdateTeamPlayerInput,
    16→} from "./player.schema";
    17→import {
    18→  type Player as PlayerSelect,
    19→  playerTable,
    20→  teamPlayerTable,
    21→} from "./player.sql";
    22→
    23→export class PlayerRepo extends Effect.Service<PlayerRepo>()("PlayerRepo", {
    24→  effect: Effect.gen(function* () {
    25→    const db = yield* PgDrizzle;
    26→
    27→    const { id: _, ...rest } = getTableColumns(playerTable);
    28→
    29→    return {
    30→      list: (input: GetAllPlayersInput) =>
    31→        Effect.gen(function* () {
    32→          const players: PlayerSelect[] = yield* db
    33→            .select(rest)
    34→            .from(playerTable)
    35→            .where(
    36→              and(
    37→                eq(playerTable.organizationId, input.organizationId),
    38→                isNull(playerTable.deletedAt),
    39→              ),
    40→            )
    41→            .pipe(Effect.tapError(Effect.logError));
    42→
    43→          return players;
    44→        }),
    45→
    46→      create: (input: CreatePlayerInput) =>
    47→        Effect.gen(function* () {
    48→          const player: PlayerSelect = yield* db
    49→            .insert(playerTable)
    50→            .values({
    51→              organizationId: input.organizationId,
    52→              userId: input.userId ?? null,
    53→              name: input.name,
    54→              email: input.email ?? null,
    55→              phone: input.phone ?? null,
    56→              dateOfBirth: input.dateOfBirth ?? null,
    57→            })
    58→            .returning(rest)
    59→            .pipe(Effect.flatMap(Arr.head), Effect.tapError(Effect.logError));
    60→
    61→          return player;
    62→        }),
    63→
    64→      update: (input: UpdatePlayerInput) =>
    65→        db
    66→          .update(playerTable)
    67→          .set({
    68→            ...(input.name !== undefined && { name: input.name }),
    69→            ...(input.email !== undefined && { email: input.email }),
    70→            ...(input.phone !== undefined && { phone: input.phone }),
    71→            ...(input.dateOfBirth !== undefined && {
    72→              dateOfBirth: input.dateOfBirth,
    73→            }),
    74→          })
    75→          .where(
    76→            and(
    77→              eq(playerTable.publicId, input.publicPlayerId),
    78→              isNull(playerTable.deletedAt),
    79→            ),
    80→          )
    81→          .returning(rest)
    82→          .pipe(Effect.flatMap(Arr.head), Effect.tapError(Effect.logError)),
    83→
    84→      delete: (input: DeletePlayerInput) =>
    85→        db
    86→          .update(playerTable)
    87→          .set({ deletedAt: new Date() })
    88→          .where(
    89→            and(
    90→              eq(playerTable.publicId, input.playerId),
    91→              isNull(playerTable.deletedAt),
    92→            ),
    93→          )
    94→          .returning(rest)
    95→          .pipe(Effect.flatMap(Arr.head), Effect.tapError(Effect.logError)),
    96→
    97→      bulkDelete: (input: BulkDeletePlayersInput) =>
    98→        db
    99→          .update(playerTable)
   100→          .set({ deletedAt: new Date() })
   101→          .where(
   102→            and(
   103→              inArray(playerTable.publicId, input.playerIds),
   104→              isNull(playerTable.deletedAt),
   105→            ),
   106→          )
   107→          .pipe(Effect.tapError(Effect.logError)),
   108→
   109→      getTeamPlayers: (input: GetTeamPlayersInput) =>
   110→        db
   111→          .select({
   112→            publicId: playerTable.publicId,
   113→            organizationId: playerTable.organizationId,
   114→            userId: playerTable.userId,
   115→            name: playerTable.name,
   116→            email: playerTable.email,
   117→            phone: playerTable.phone,
   118→            dateOfBirth: playerTable.dateOfBirth,
   119→            createdAt: playerTable.createdAt,
   120→            updatedAt: playerTable.updatedAt,
   121→            deletedAt: playerTable.deletedAt,
   122→            teamId: teamPlayerTable.teamId,
   123→            jerseyNumber: teamPlayerTable.jerseyNumber,
   124→            position: teamPlayerTable.position,
   125→          })
   126→          .from(playerTable)
   127→          .innerJoin(
   128→            teamPlayerTable,
   129→            eq(playerTable.id, teamPlayerTable.playerId),
   130→          )
   131→          .where(
   132→            and(
   133→              eq(teamPlayerTable.teamId, input.teamId),
   134→              isNull(playerTable.deletedAt),
   135→            ),
   136→          )
   137→          .pipe(Effect.tapError(Effect.logError)),
   138→
   139→      getPlayerIdByPublicId: (publicId: string) =>
   140→        db
   141→          .select({ id: playerTable.id })
   142→          .from(playerTable)
   143→          .where(
   144→            and(
   145→              eq(playerTable.publicId, publicId),
   146→              isNull(playerTable.deletedAt),
   147→            ),
   148→          )
   149→          .pipe(Effect.flatMap(Arr.head), Effect.tapError(Effect.logError)),
   150→
   151→      addPlayerToTeam: (playerId: number, input: AddPlayerToTeamInput) =>
   152→        db
   153→          .insert(teamPlayerTable)
   154→          .values({
   155→            teamId: input.teamId,
   156→            playerId,
   157→            jerseyNumber: input.jerseyNumber ?? null,
   158→            position: input.position ?? null,
   159→          })
   160→          .returning()
   161→          .pipe(Effect.flatMap(Arr.head), Effect.tapError(Effect.logError)),
   162→
   163→      updateTeamPlayer: (playerId: number, input: UpdateTeamPlayerInput) =>
   164→        db
   165→          .update(teamPlayerTable)
   166→          .set({
   167→            ...(input.jerseyNumber !== undefined && {
   168→              jerseyNumber: input.jerseyNumber,
   169→            }),
   170→            ...(input.position !== undefined && { position: input.position }),
   171→          })
   172→          .where(
   173→            and(
   174→              eq(teamPlayerTable.teamId, input.teamId),
   175→              eq(teamPlayerTable.playerId, playerId),
   176→            ),
   177→          )
   178→          .returning()
   179→          .pipe(Effect.flatMap(Arr.head), Effect.tapError(Effect.logError)),
   180→
   181→      removePlayerFromTeam: (playerId: number, teamId: string) =>
   182→        db
   183→          .delete(teamPlayerTable)
   184→          .where(
   185→            and(
   186→              eq(teamPlayerTable.teamId, teamId),
   187→              eq(teamPlayerTable.playerId, playerId),
   188→            ),
   189→          )
   190→          .pipe(Effect.tapError(Effect.logError)),
   191→
   192→      bulkRemovePlayersFromTeam: (playerIds: number[], teamId: string) =>
   193→        db
   194→          .delete(teamPlayerTable)
   195→          .where(
   196→            and(
   197→              eq(teamPlayerTable.teamId, teamId),
   198→              inArray(teamPlayerTable.playerId, playerIds),
   199→            ),
   200→          )
   201→          .pipe(Effect.tapError(Effect.logError)),
   202→
   203→      getPlayerIdsByPublicIds: (publicIds: string[]) =>
   204→        db
   205→          .select({ id: playerTable.id })
   206→          .from(playerTable)
   207→          .where(
   208→            and(
   209→              inArray(playerTable.publicId, publicIds),
   210→              isNull(playerTable.deletedAt),
   211→            ),
   212→          )
   213→          .pipe(Effect.tapError(Effect.logError)),
   214→    } as const;
   215→  }),
   216→  dependencies: [DatabaseLive],
   217→}) {}
   218→

1→import { PgDrizzle } from "@effect/sql-drizzle/Pg";
     2→import { and, eq, getTableColumns, isNull } from "drizzle-orm";
     3→import { Array as Arr, Effect } from "effect";
     4→
     5→import { DatabaseLive } from "../drizzle/drizzle.service";
     6→
     7→import type {
     8→  CreateSeasonInput,
     9→  DeleteSeasonInput,
    10→  GetAllSeasonsInput,
    11→  GetSeasonInput,
    12→  UpdateSeasonInput,
    13→} from "./season.schema";
    14→import { type SeasonSelect, seasonTable } from "./season.sql";
    15→
    16→export class SeasonRepo extends Effect.Service<SeasonRepo>()("SeasonRepo", {
    17→  effect: Effect.gen(function* () {
    18→    const db = yield* PgDrizzle;
    19→
    20→    const { id: _, ...rest } = getTableColumns(seasonTable);
    21→
    22→    return {
    23→      list: (input: GetAllSeasonsInput) =>
    24→        Effect.gen(function* () {
    25→          const seasons: SeasonSelect[] = yield* db
    26→            .select(rest)
    27→            .from(seasonTable)
    28→            .where(
    29→              and(
    30→                eq(seasonTable.organizationId, input.organizationId),
    31→                input.teamId ? eq(seasonTable.teamId, input.teamId) : undefined,
    32→                isNull(seasonTable.deletedAt),
    33→              ),
    34→            )
    35→            .pipe(Effect.tapError(Effect.logError));
    36→
    37→          return seasons;
    38→        }),
    39→      get: (input: GetSeasonInput) =>
    40→        Effect.gen(function* () {
    41→          const season: SeasonSelect = yield* db
    42→            .select(rest)
    43→            .from(seasonTable)
    44→            .where(
    45→              and(
    46→                eq(seasonTable.publicId, input.publicId),
    47→                eq(seasonTable.organizationId, input.organizationId),
    48→                input.teamId ? eq(seasonTable.teamId, input.teamId) : undefined,
    49→                isNull(seasonTable.deletedAt),
    50→              ),
    51→            )
    52→            .pipe(Effect.flatMap(Arr.head), Effect.tapError(Effect.logError));
    53→
    54→          return season;
    55→        }),
    56→      create: (input: CreateSeasonInput) =>
    57→        Effect.gen(function* () {
    58→          const season: SeasonSelect = yield* db
    59→            .insert(seasonTable)
    60→            .values({
    61→              organizationId: input.organizationId,
    62→              teamId: input.teamId,
    63→              name: input.name,
    64→              startDate: input.startDate,
    65→              endDate: input.endDate ?? null,
    66→              status: input.status ?? "active",
    67→              division: input.division ?? null,
    68→            })
    69→            .returning(rest)
    70→            .pipe(Effect.flatMap(Arr.head), Effect.tapError(Effect.logError));
    71→
    72→          return season;
    73→        }),
    74→      update: (input: UpdateSeasonInput) =>
    75→        db
    76→          .update(seasonTable)
    77→          .set({
    78→            ...(input.name !== undefined && { name: input.name }),
    79→            ...(input.startDate !== undefined && {
    80→              startDate: input.startDate,
    81→            }),
    82→            ...(input.endDate !== undefined && { endDate: input.endDate }),
    83→            ...(input.status !== undefined && { status: input.status }),
    84→            ...(input.division !== undefined && { division: input.division }),
    85→          })
    86→          .where(
    87→            and(
    88→              eq(seasonTable.publicId, input.publicId),
    89→              eq(seasonTable.organizationId, input.organizationId),
    90→              // FIX: add nullish team id to this...

    92→              isNull(seasonTable.deletedAt),
    93→            ),
    94→          )
    95→          .returning(rest)
    96→          .pipe(Effect.flatMap(Arr.head), Effect.tapError(Effect.logError)),
    97→      delete: (input: DeleteSeasonInput) =>
    98→        db
    99→          .update(seasonTable)
   100→          .set({ deletedAt: new Date() })
   101→          .where(
   102→            and(
   103→              eq(seasonTable.publicId, input.publicId),
   104→              eq(seasonTable.organizationId, input.organizationId),
   105→              // FIX: add nullish team id to this...
   106→              // ...{ decoded.teamId && { ...eq(seasonTable.teamId, decoded.teamId) } },
   107→              isNull(seasonTable.deletedAt),
   108→            ),
   109→          )
   110→          .returning(rest)
   111→          .pipe(Effect.flatMap(Arr.head), Effect.tapError(Effect.logError)),
   112→    } as const;
   113→  }),
   114→  dependencies: [DatabaseLive],
   115→}) {}

{/* Voice */}

Voice

Do

  • State facts plainly
  • Be specific over general
  • Respect the reader's time
  • Let data speak

Don't

  • Hype or exaggerate
  • Use jargon for its own sake
  • Editorialize in data contexts
  • Add filler or qualifiers

The tone is knowledgeable but not academic. Direct but not blunt. We write like someone who watches a lot of lacrosse and happens to understand databases.

{/* Principles */}

Design Principles

Data over decoration

Every visual element should serve comprehension. Ornament is noise.

Monochrome discipline

Restraint in color forces clarity in layout and typography. Color is reserved for data visualization where it serves a semantic purpose.

Editorial quality

The reading experience should feel like a well-typeset publication, not a SaaS dashboard. Serif headings, generous spacing, considered hierarchy.

import { createFileRoute } from "@tanstack/react-router"; export const Route = createFileRoute("/about")({ component: About, }); function About() { return (

About LaxDB

The lacrosse data platform.

What we do

LaxDB is building the definitive data layer for professional lacrosse. We aggregate, normalize, and serve statistics across the PLL, NLL, MLL, MSL, and WLA — leagues that have historically kept their data siloed and inconsistent.

The result is a single platform where player careers can be traced across leagues and eras, where game data is structured and queryable, and where the sport's history is preserved in a format that's actually useful.

Why it matters

Lacrosse is the fastest-growing sport in North America but its data infrastructure hasn't kept pace. Box scores disappear when league websites shut down. Career stats are scattered across PDFs, spreadsheets, and defunct websites. Comparing a PLL attackman's production to an NLL forward's requires manual work that almost nobody does.

We think the sport deserves better. Good data doesn't just serve analysts — it deepens every fan's understanding of what they're watching.

How it works

  • Pipeline — automated ingestion from league APIs, historical archives, and structured scraping of public sources.
  • Normalization — unified schemas that reconcile different league formats, naming conventions, and statistical categories.
  • Knowledge graph — entities linked by relationships (teammates, opponents, career paths) enabling discovery and analysis.

Open source

LaxDB is open source. The data pipeline, API, and this website are all public. We believe lacrosse data should be accessible to everyone — fans, journalists, coaches, analysts, and developers building tools for the sport.

View on GitHub

Contact

For questions, data corrections, or partnership inquiries:{" "} jack@laxdb.io

); }

import { Logo } from "@laxdb/ui/components/logo"; import { createFileRoute } from "@tanstack/react-router"; const PALETTE = [ { name: "Background", variable: "--color-background", light: "oklch(0.96 0.007 70)", dark: "oklch(0.21 0.006 70)", }, { name: "Foreground", variable: "--color-foreground", light: "oklch(0.17 0 0)", dark: "oklch(0.985 0 0)", }, { name: "Primary", variable: "--color-primary", light: "oklch(0.205 0 0)", dark: "oklch(0.87 0 0)", }, { name: "Muted", variable: "--color-muted-foreground", light: "oklch(0.51 0 0)", dark: "oklch(0.73 0 0)", }, { name: "Subtle", variable: "--color-subtle", light: "oklch(0.63 0 0)", dark: "oklch(0.51 0 0)" }, { name: "Accent", variable: "--color-accent", light: "oklch(0.91 0 0)", dark: "oklch(0.3 0 0)" }, { name: "Border", variable: "--color-border", light: "oklch(0.93 0 0)", dark: "oklch(0.32 0 0)" }, { name: "Border Strong", variable: "--color-border-strong", light: "oklch(0.89 0 0)", dark: "oklch(0.4 0 0)", }, { name: "Bullet", variable: "--color-bullet", light: "oklch(0.82 0 0)", dark: "oklch(0.4 0 0)" }, { name: "Orange", variable: "--color-orange", light: "oklch(0.55 0.12 50)", dark: "oklch(0.65 0.14 50)", }, ] as const; export const Route = createFileRoute("/brand")({ component: BrandGuidelines, }); function BrandGuidelines() { return (

Brand Guidelines

Visual identity and design reference for LaxDB.

{/* Logo */}

Logo

LaxDB
LaxDB

The mark is a circle — a deliberate reduction. It references the lacrosse ball while signaling that LaxDB is a platform, not a league or media brand.

Minimum clear space: 1x the diameter of the mark on all sides.

{/* Typography */}

Typography

Display / Headings

Newsreader

Optical sizes, italic only for headings. Weight 400. Provides editorial character without nostalgia.

Body / UI

Helvetica Neue

System fallback stack: Helvetica Neue, Helvetica, Inter, system sans-serif. Clean, invisible, lets the content lead.

Scale

Page Title text-2xl / text-3xl
Section Heading text-lg
Body text at fifteen pixels 15px / relaxed
Secondary and metadata text-sm
Tertiary labels and dates text-xs
{/* Color */}

Color

Near-monochrome core in OKLCH for perceptual uniformity. Background carries a subtle warm tint (hue 70). Dark mode inverts the scale. Orange is the only saturated chromatic accent.

{PALETTE.map((color) => (
{color.name}
{color.variable}
))}
{/* Voice */}

Voice

Do

  • State facts plainly
  • Be specific over general
  • Respect the reader's time
  • Let data speak

Don't

  • Hype or exaggerate
  • Use jargon for its own sake
  • Editorialize in data contexts
  • Add filler or qualifiers

The tone is knowledgeable but not academic. Direct but not blunt. We write like someone who watches a lot of lacrosse and happens to understand databases.

{/* Principles */}

Design Principles

Data over decoration

Every visual element should serve comprehension. Ornament is noise.

Monochrome discipline

Restraint in color forces clarity in layout and typography. Color is reserved for data visualization where it serves a semantic purpose.

Editorial quality

The reading experience should feel like a well-typeset publication, not a SaaS dashboard. Serif headings, generous spacing, considered hierarchy.

); }

import { createFileRoute } from "@tanstack/react-router"; export const Route = createFileRoute("/about")({ component: About, }); function About() { return (

About LaxDB

The lacrosse data platform.

What we do

LaxDB is building the definitive data layer for professional lacrosse. We aggregate, normalize, and serve statistics across the PLL, NLL, MLL, MSL, and WLA — leagues that have historically kept their data siloed and inconsistent.

The result is a single platform where player careers can be traced across leagues and eras, where game data is structured and queryable, and where the sport's history is preserved in a format that's actually useful.

Why it matters

Lacrosse is the fastest-growing sport in North America but its data infrastructure hasn't kept pace. Box scores disappear when league websites shut down. Career stats are scattered across PDFs, spreadsheets, and defunct websites. Comparing a PLL attackman's production to an NLL forward's requires manual work that almost nobody does.

We think the sport deserves better. Good data doesn't just serve analysts — it deepens every fan's understanding of what they're watching.

How it works

  • Pipeline — automated ingestion from league APIs, historical archives, and structured scraping of public sources.
  • Normalization — unified schemas that reconcile different league formats, naming conventions, and statistical categories.
  • Knowledge graph — entities linked by relationships (teammates, opponents, career paths) enabling discovery and analysis.

Open source

LaxDB is open source. The data pipeline, API, and this website are all public. We believe lacrosse data should be accessible to everyone — fans, journalists, coaches, analysts, and developers building tools for the sport.

View on GitHub

Contact

For questions, data corrections, or partnership inquiries:{" "} jack@laxdb.io

); }

preserved in a format that's actually useful.

The lacrosse data platform.

What we do

LaxDB is building the definitive data layer for professional lacrosse. We aggregate, normalize, and serve statistics across the PLL, NLL, MLL, MSL, and WLA — leagues that have historically kept their data siloed and inconsistent.

The result is a single platform where player careers can be traced across leagues and eras, where game data is structured and queryable, and where the sport's history is preserved in a format that's actually useful.

Why it matters

Lacrosse is the fastest-growing sport in North America but its data infrastructure hasn't kept pace. Box scores disappear when league websites shut down. Career stats are scattered across PDFs, spreadsheets, and defunct websites. Comparing a PLL attackman's production to an NLL forward's requires manual work that almost nobody does.

We think the sport deserves better. Good data doesn't just serve analysts — it deepens every fan's understanding of what they're watching.

How it works

  • Pipeline — automated ingestion from league APIs, historical archives, and structured scraping of public sources.
  • Normalization — unified schemas that reconcile different league formats, naming conventions, and statistical categories.
  • Knowledge graph — entities linked by relationships (teammates, opponents, career paths) enabling discovery and analysis.

Open source

LaxDB is open source. The data pipeline, API, and this website are all public. We believe lacrosse data should be accessible to everyone — fans, journalists, coaches, analysts, and developers building tools for the sport.

View on GitHub

Contact

For questions, data corrections, or partnership inquiries:{" "} jack@laxdb.io

); }
